title: Who's Going to Regulate All These Private Space Stations?
description: A host of companies are in the process of developing commercial space stations. Aside from the complexities of assembling these structures in low Earth orbit, these companies are also trying to figure out which government agency should serve as the regulator once their orbital outposts are up and running.

title: Astronomers Detect What Could Be Most Powerful Explosion Ever Recorded
description:
Astronomers have detected a big boom in the distant universe that they believe may be the most powerful explosion ever recorded. It’s already got a nickname: ‘BOAT,’ or the Brightest Of All Time.

title: Beyond Meat Plans to Chew Out 19% of Workforce as It Sees Revenue Drops
description: Beyond Meat is looking a little thin lately, especially considering the repeated blows the fake meat market has taken since 2021. Now it’s becoming more clear the company’s profits have been butterflied and pounded into a thin morsel of what they once were.

title: There's a Traffic Jam on the Mississippi River
description:
The Mississippi River’s water levels are so low that it’s messing with barge traffic and recreational boat travel along the crucial waterway.

title: Equifax Wages War on Employees Working Second Jobs
description:
Equifax is sending a message to its work force by firing at least two dozen of them. The company has allegedly used its own software to identify remote employees working another full-time job while employed by Equifax.

title: RIP Robbie Coltrane, 1950-2022
description: The Scottish actor and comedian Robbie Coltrane has died, as reported by the Hollywood Reporter.

title: Meta Allegedly Failed to Stop a Months Long Canadian Immigration Scam Targeting Migrants
description: Scammers posing as Canadian immigration experts exploited Facebook and WhatsApp groups to target migrants in a months long data harvesting scheme. In some cases, migrants wrapped up in the scam are convinced to recruit over a dozen more desperate people, allegedly in exchange for help applying and paying for a visa.…

title: Site of Collapsed Arecibo Telescope Will Become an Education Center
description:
The National Science Foundation announced this week that the site of the destroyed Arecibo Observatory radio telescope in Puerto Rico will become a STEM-focused educational center, and it’s seeking proposals to manage the new project.
